prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on the white background, with the top and bottom faces parallel to each other, and the curved side perpendicular to both. The length of the curved side is approximately twice the length of the top and bottom faces. The prism is centered horizontally and vertically on the white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation vector: (0.2785, 0.106, 0.0) 2. Draw a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create face_1 in the sketch with the following loop: * Loop_1 contains 7 lines: 1. line_1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.644, 0.0) 2. line_2: (0.644, 0.0) to (0.4973, 0.0543) 3. line_3: (0.4973, 0.0543) to (0.4647, 0.0978) 4. line_4: (0.4647, 0.0978) to (0.3886, 0.1168) 5. line_5: (0.3886, 0.1168) to (0.3125, 0.0652) 6. line_6: (0.3125, 0.0652) to (0.0, 0.0652) 7. line_7: (0.0, 0.0652) to (0.0, 0.0) Part 2 Instructions Create a duplicate of Part 1 with the same dimensions and sketch but without extruding it. We will use this in the boolean operation of the next part. Part 3 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a pointed top and a flat bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) * Translation vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0652) 2. Draw a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create face_1 in the sketch with the following loop: * Loop_1 contains 8 lines: 1. line_1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.5978, 0.0) 2. line_2: (0.5978, 0.0) to (0.5978, 0.106) 3. line_3: (0.5978, 0.106) to (0.3193, 0.4185) 4. line_4: (0.3193, 0.4185) to (0.3193, 0.106) 5. line_5: (0.3193, 0.106) to (0.2785, 0.106) 6. line_6: (0.2785, 0.106) to (0.2785, 0.4185) 7. line_7: (0.2785, 0.4185) to (0.0, 0.106) 8. line_8: (0.0, 0.106) to (0.0, 0.0) 4. Extrude the sketch by 0.0136 units in the positive Z direction, creating a pointed top. 5. Perform a boolean operation to subtract Part 2 from Part 3, creating a triangular prism with a flat base and a pointed top, featuring a rectangular cross-section and a curved edge.</description>
